text: Episynlestes intermedius is a species of Australian damselfly in the family Synlestidae, commonly known as an intermediate whitetip. It is endemic to the Eungella area of Queensland, where it inhabits streams. Episynlestes intermedius is a large, very slender damselfly, coloured a dull bronze-black with white markings. It often perches with its wings outspread. ==Gallery== Episynlestes intermedius female wings (34695956231).jpg | Female wings Episynlestes intermedius male wings (34695963161).jpg | Male wings ==See also== * List of Odonata species of Australia == References == Category:Synlestidae Category:Odonata of Australia Category:Insects of Australia Category:Endemic fauna of Australia Category:Taxa named by Günther Theischinger Category:Taxa named by J.A.L. (Tony) Watson Category:Insects described in 1985 Category:Damselflies
title: Episynlestes intermedius
